snippet: Representative Steve Scalise’s effort to explain why he accepted a speaking engagement offered by an aide to Mr. Duke in 2002 was a reminder of choices Louisiana Republicans faced in the past.
abstract: Rep Steve Scalise's attempts to explain away speech he gave at event held by David Duke's European Unity and Rights Organization is a reminder of time when Republicans in Louisiana had to deal with Duke's white supremacist views in 1990s; episode is also sign of how many Southern politicians have coopted much of Duke's strategy of appealing to frustrations and resentments of white voters.

byline.contributor: Alan Rappeport contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Representative Steve Scalise’s effort to explain why he accepted a speaking engagement offered by an aide to Mr. Duke in 2002 was a reminder of choices Louisiana Republicans faced in the past.

headline.main: Much of David Duke’s ’91 Campaign Is Now in Louisiana Mainstream
headline.print_headline: Much of David Duke’s ’91 Campaign Is Now in Louisiana Mainstream
